decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing fast mana and graveyard recursion to quickly assemble a game-winning combo. By using cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to power out spells, the deck is able to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Narcomoeba and Elvish Spirit Guide. Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer are then used to mill the entire deck, before Thassa's Oracle is used to win the game on the spot. Pact of Negation and Cabal Therapy provide disruption and protection, while Agadeem's Awakening can be used to bring back key creatures from the graveyard.

This deck revolves around assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo, using Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to fill the graveyard with Narcomoeba and enable Thassa's Oracle win condition. The deck also includes disruption like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and interaction with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Cabal Therapy. Urza's Saga provides additional value, while cards like Prismatic Ending offer removal options. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and disrupt opponent's game plan to secure a win.

This deck focuses on using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the opponent's resources while deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to pressure the opponent's life total. The deck also utilizes tempo plays like Daze and Brazen Borrower to disrupt the opponent's game plan and keep them off balance. With a mix of card selection and efficient removal spells, this deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and win the game through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo, using cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to quickly cast Doomsday and set up a winning pile with Thassa's Oracle. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student can help find key pieces, while Psychic Frog can provide additional card advantage. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly disrupt and control the opponent's game plan by playing powerful red dragons and locking down the opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon and Chalice of the Void. By utilizing mana acceleration and aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Pyrogoyf, this deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early in the game and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Unlicensed Hearse and Sundering Eruption provides additional removal and reach to secure the win.

The Merfolk deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient creatures that benefit from Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. With disruption provided by cards like Mistcaller and Force of Will, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Svyelun of Sea and Sky. Utilizing Aether Vial for flexibility in deploying creatures and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base, the deck seeks to control the game tempo and apply pressure with its tribal synergy and disruptive elements.

This UWx Control deck focuses on efficiently controlling the board and disrupting opponents with counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to maintain card advantage and board presence through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Brainsurge. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending, as well as powerful finishers like Entreat the Angels and Supreme Verdict. The inclusion of Blood Moon can also disrupt multicolor decks, while cards like Terminus and Consign to Memory provide additional answers to threats.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy using cards like Thoughtseize and Pithing Needle while also utilizing powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Dauthi Voidwalker to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Reanimate and Fell the Profane provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's plans while also fueling aggressive plays. The deck also includes various removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict to control the board and keep the opponent on the back foot. Overall, this deck aims to control the game early and win through aggressive plays and disruption.

This deck revolves around creating a loop with Nomads en-Kor and Delighted Halfling to draw and play your entire library, eventually winning with Nadu, Winged Wisdom. The deck also includes disruption through Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, along with card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. Green Sun's Zenith and Prismatic Ending provide additional flexibility, while Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect your combo. The mana base includes a variety of dual lands and fetchlands to support the deck's multiple colors and maximize consistency.

The deck revolves around utilizing the combo interaction between Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire library. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Bauble provide extra milling and card advantage. The deck includes various artifact synergies such as Mox Opal, Urza's Saga, and Mishra's Bauble to ramp up quickly and protect the combo with cards like Force of Will. Additionally, cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Sai, Master Thopterist help provide additional value and board presence.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Control - Pox deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by using various discard spells, removal spells, and land destruction cards. The deck aims to control the board state by sacrificing resources, making it difficult for the opponent to develop their game plan. Additionally, cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Liliana of the Veil help to keep the opponent's creatures at bay, while Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga provide additional utility and threats. The deck's strategy revolves around denying the opponent resources and outlasting them in a war of attrition.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful stifle effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing Phyrexian Dreadnought as a win condition. The deck also includes a variety of control elements such as countermagic, removal spells, and card draw to help maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Triumph of Saint Katherine provides additional card advantage and versatility to help close out the game. Overall, the deck focuses on disruption, control, and incremental advantage to secure victory.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and fast mana sources to cast a high storm count spell such as Tendrils of Agony or Grapeshot to win the game. It includes various cantrips and hand disruption spells to find combo pieces and protect the combo from disruption. The deck also utilizes Wishclaw Talisman to tutor for key combo pieces, while Veil of Summer protects from disruption and provides card advantage. The inclusion of Gaea's Will allows for a reset of resources and a potential second turn storm kill.
